title: If you have 'The Truth' would you ask any question? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you are referring to The Truth (with a capital "T"), meaning "All Truth" or "Ultimate Truth" or something similar which denotes an 'all-encompassing understanding of everything'...then I guess there would be no need to ask any questions, since the answers are already known. Knowing all would place one in such a high level of consciousness that they might not know what a question even is, since they've never had any need for one...perhaps THAT would be the only question they might ask? I.E.:"What is a question?"Just sayin'...

No. If you know the truth, you would be know it is sometimes better not too.My life is a search for the truth. What makes me happy ? What do other really think ? Do others love me ? I am I capable of love ? How should love look like ? Maybe there is not one, but many truths when it comes down to ways to get the same end results. Also, what truth you are looking for ? If your view is selective, the truth does not matter, because you will be only looking for that what confirms what you are thinking.We just have to take a leap of faith.
